issue.title: [CF 630] Renewing Mist Tracking
issue.body:
Thank you for your continued hard work, I have a Renewing Mist request in the spirit of the mod "Renewing Mist Watcher" (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/renewingmistwatcher/).  I would like an icon or set of icons to display two things.  The shortest amount of time left on any of my Renewing Mists on party or raid targets, so I know when to either Uplift or Thunder Focus Tea, and the number of active Renewing Mists on party or raid members so I can Uplift or TFT for the greatest effect.  This can either be two icons which individually track either request, or single icon with stack size in the middle and either a border that indicates the last few seconds or an additional timer above or below.  Thank you again.


> Posted by CurseForge user Adapted | Imported from CurseForge issue #630 | Raw

comments.body:
This should do the trick for the shortest duration on party and raid members:

^1^T^SUnit^Splayer;~`party;~`raid ^SSort^N-1 ^SType^Sbuff ^SUnAlpha^N0.3 ^SName^SRenewing~`Mist ^SShowWhen^N3 ^SEnabled^B ^t^N60410^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

Tracking the total number is going to require a special icon type to be made. I can't make any promises or any guesses on when I might be able to get around to doing such a thing, though.

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

There's probably a better/more efficient way of doing it but, while Cybeloras is working on the proper solution, I've created a custom dogtag (see code below) to keep track of the stacks. It appears to be working correctly and I haven't noticed any performance issues so far in 10/25/40-man raiding environments. Just thought I'd share for anyone looking for a workaround without having to switch to WeakAuras.

``` local DogTag = LibStub("LibDogTag-3.0") local L = DogTag.L DogTag:AddTag("Unit", "RaidStacks", { code = function(aura) local prefix = "raid" local numPlayers = GetNumGroupMembers() local numAuras = 0 if not IsInRaid() then prefix = "party" numPlayers = numPlayers-1 local _, _, _, _, _, _, expirationTime, _, _, _, _ = UnitAura("player", aura, nil, "PLAYER|HELPFUL") if expirationTime ~= nil then numAuras = numAuras + 1 end end for i=1,numPlayers do local unit = prefix..i local _, _, _, _, _, _, expirationTime, _, _, _, _ = UnitAura(unit, aura, nil, "PLAYER|HELPFUL") if expirationTime ~= nil then numAuras = numAuras + 1 end end return numAuras end, arg = { 'aura', "string", '@req' }, ret = "number", events = "Update", doc = L["Return the total number of units in raid/party that have the specified aura"], example = '[RaidStacks("Renewing Mist")] => "5"', category = L["Auras"] }) ```
Edited Feb 11, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user lzarro

Just wanted to say thanks to Izarro. This custom dog tag works wonderfully. It'd be great if the addon author could add this as one of the standard dogtags, as I could see it being equally useful for other aura tracking. (Hots, shields, I dunno, whatever.)
